th.content: A Class holds a skeleton of data. Thus datas have similarities in some ways that can be asigned and accsessed. 			>> Createing a class 															class nameOfClass:															                class Employee:                class Employee:                class Employee:		class Employee:																def __init__(self, name, lastName, pay):												self.name = name														self.lastName = lastName													self.pay = pay													> 'self' is the inistance that is asigned from outside of the class. and 'def __init__' is a constracotr		 that asigns the class object to the inistance name.											emp1 = Employee("fikir", "getahun", "5000000")										 here the emp1 is an Employee. the objects of the class are the data to be accesed					>> Class Variables can be accesed in two ways. first, is through instance and second is through the class				ex:	class Employee:																var = 80															def __init__() # i will just leave it there unfinished to show the concept							def firstName(self):																		print(self.var) # this prints the var 80 if there is no instance from outside to change var likethis 'emp1.var = 90' now the var is 90 to the instance 'emp1'
